Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: black-glazed (only traces remaining); exterior: possible part of painted single band above frieze of thin vertical strokes (fired brown) rising from narrow band; band on outer and inner face of foot; underside: two rings at outer edge.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.255) (phase 3)
